intro: Anthocercis leichhardtii, commonly known as the Leichhardt's anthocercis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
